rationale: HPI captures inconsistent amlodipine pickup, patient lives alone, and new-onset fatigue, but omits that the patient already owns a pill organizer and uses it inconsistently.
Lists amlodipine but leaves out the 10 mg dosage; documents negative ankle/foot swelling inquiry and fatigue complaint.
Plan clearly records clinician advice to set phone reminders and use pill organizer consistently, covering the two specified adherence supports.
No documented plan for BP follow-up, edema monitoring, or fatigue work-up, so safety measures are essentially absent.
Includes the key social detail that patient lives alone and adds no irrelevant copy-paste content.
